title: Riot, you know that Zed uses ENERGY, right?
body:
Because his "healthy" pattern of "poking from a distance and waiting for the moment to strike is layered with counterplay and complexity." 

Due to him basically being resourceless in lane "complexity" boils down to "press Q in general direction of enemy every 6 seconds". And "counterplay" involves "rush Zhonyas or die". Which is real fair, considering you forfeit your mana regeneration item, making an even bigger gap between you and Zed's maleness wave clear/poke.

Good job Riot, protecting your LC$BIGPLAYS champions. Can't have them actually having weaknesess. But god forbid someone like Urgot or Sona starts seeing play.

I find is interesting how many people seem to jump on the "nerf" bandwagon. Everyone seems to agree on a few champions that either need small tweaks or are generally balanced and then they just spam complaints about how poorly this game is balance. Then, they refuse to look at both sides of the argument because they won't let themselves be proven wrong. An example of this is how people get so worked up about energy champions. yet there are resource-less champions like Gnar who can be just as much of a menace yet has nothing to stop them from using their spells off cooldown. 

In the case of Zed, at least he does have to be somewhat mindful about using abilities. For example, if he uses his spells to waveclear, then he will not have enough energy to fight, whereas champions who use no resources can do whatever they want whenever they want. This is my point on how people love to join together and complain about a problem while they don't actually think about their arguments. 

And look at the comments that get downvoted. They aren't the troll comments that ruin discussion but they are the comments that argue the opposite side of the argument. So many people instantly downvote anything that doesn't align with their opinion and they refuse to actually discuss about what could be done, and I have no doubt this post will be downvoted to oblivion. 

One other thing I find interesting is how people also complain about using Reddit compared to Boards, maybe it is because on reddit people actually attempt to understand what other people's arguments are. Instead of barraging the comment with downvotes.

replies.body: Okay here goes. Before you complain about the champ know the champ. Zed's typical poke combo is e-q with a possible w. This can NOT be spammed every 6 seconds. Speaking of mana and energy. I would prefer mana on zed, and here's why. Mana on zed would be op, since his usual combo drains every ounce of energy from his bar. Sure energy regens faster, but you get a hell of a lot less. If zed had mana, you all would complain even more. All the energy does is assist his early game weakness a little. Giving him mana would hinder him early, but he would be unstoppable late. Before you cry, know what you're complaining about.

If zed uses his weq combo and hits his abilities it costs him 125 energy, but he gets 80 refunded for a grand total of 45 energy. 6 seconds later he can eq again but by then he has regenerated to full energy. He can use his w on cd and his eq on the 6 sec cooldown of his q and maintain his energy for ~1:45. He can use his abilities on cd for nearly two minutes without going ooe. Compare that to another energy user like shen whose combo costs 210 energy (read more energy than he has) and if he hits his target only gets 40 refunded. shen has to hit his abilities to get one spell rotation while zed can maintain his for nearly two minutes. \#dothemath 

For god sakes don't make him mana based that would be terrible, but his energy costs need to be meaningful.

but the amount of energy he gives up for his combo comes back pretty damn fast compared to the chunk of health he takes from you and the  CS he denies you. i agree that he shouldnt have mana (because he'd build manamune and it'd be over), but they need to relook at his energy system and figure something out. at least to weaken his early game because he shouldnt be strong at all points in the game

All in all he's not terrible, and almost everything the first commenter that's below the threshold says, at the time of writing this I can't think of anything that's wrong with what he mentioned. I always tell people rule #1 for going against the shadow man with jukes for years, DODGE his Q. Do that, and you should be okay to get out of lane and roam or shitstomp him because you have farm, and items, and CC and the most he has is a slow.

The biggest thing there is he gets farm too, and rather well with his passive. I think a great way to nerf Zed but still keep his core gameplay, **would be to remove the ability for his passive to proc on minions or neutral monsters**. This would make his farm a crap ton harder, but he still retains the ability to do stupid amounts of damage to champions.
